```{r setup, include = FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  collapse = TRUE,
  comment = "#>"
)

library(echarts4r)
```

```{r}
# data.frame
df <- data.frame(
  x = 1:100,
  y = rnorm(100, 20, 12)
)
```

## Histogram

```{r}
df %>% 
  e_charts() %>% 
  e_histogram(y) %>% 
  e_tooltip()
```

### Density

Plot the density on a different Y axis as its range differs much from the that of the histogram.

```{r}
df %>%
  e_charts() %>% 
  e_histogram(y) %>% 
  e_density(y, name = "density", areaStyle = list(opacity = .4), 
            smooth = TRUE, y.index = 1) %>% 
  e_tooltip()
```

## Fit

Functions leverage R buil-in:

* `lm`
* `glm`
* `loess`

#### Linear

```{r}
df %>% 
  e_charts(x) %>% 
  e_scatter(y) %>% 
  e_lm(y ~ x)
```

#### Generalised Linear

```{r}
CO2 %>% 
  e_charts(conc) %>% 
  e_scatter(uptake) %>% 
  e_glm(uptake ~ conc, name = "GLM")
```

#### Polynomial

```{r}
mtcars %>% 
  e_charts(disp) %>% 
  e_scatter(mpg) %>% 
  e_loess(mpg ~ disp)
```
